intro: Zephyranthes depauperata, commonly known as the common rain lily, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States and parts of Central America. It is a bulbous perennial that produces delicate, white, star-shaped flowers during the summer months. The plant prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that emerge from the base of the plant. Zephyranthes depauperata is known for its ability to thrive in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or limestone soils.
